parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To shake off. From apo and tinasso; to brush off.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Dust. From the base of koniao and ornumi; pulverulence.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of martus; something evidential, i.e. evidence given or, the Decalogue.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
